source.title: Prefrontal-Subthalamic Hyperdirect Pathway Modulates Movement Inhibition in Humans

confidence_rationale: Human pathway evidence links prefrontal-STN signaling to movement inhibition, directly aligning with primed-but-inhibited readiness.

mapping.source_claim_statement: Activity along prefrontal-subthalamic projections modulates inhibition of movement in humans.
mapping.ree_translation: Supports MECH-026 claim that vigilance mode can hold motor output in check while remaining prepared for release.
mapping.mapping_caveat: Clinical/recording context limits direct translation to all cognitive vigilance scenarios.
mapping.source_context: Human neurophysiology examining hyperdirect pathway and inhibitory control.

confidence_components.notes: High-value human evidence for motor suppression control.
